Module app
Package appv2.cards

Class ACard

java.lang.Object
appv2.cards.ACard
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaronTalus, CountessWilhelmina, GuardOdette, HandmaidSusannah, KingArnaud, PriestTomas, PrinceArnaud, PrincessAnnette
public abstract sealed class ACard extends Object permits BaronTalus, CountessWilhelmina, GuardOdette, HandmaidSusannah, KingArnaud, PriestTomas, PrinceArnaud, PrincessAnnette

Abstract super class for all cards.

    • RC_OK

      public static final int RC_OK

      Return code if the card was played successfully.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • RC_ERR

      public static final int RC_ERR

      Return code if the card was not played successfully (e.g. blocked by the Handmaid (HandmaidSusannah) or card can not be played due to other card in hand (CountessWilhelmina)).

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • RC_OK_HANDS_UPDATED

      public static final int RC_OK_HANDS_UPDATED

      Return code if the card was played successfully and the players hands have been already updated. The caller must not update the hands again.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ACard

      Parameters:
      name - Name of the card.
      backgroundStory - Background story of the card.
      effectDescription - Description of the effect of the card.
      affection - Affection of the card.

  • Method Details

    • playCard

      public abstract int playCard(PlayerController PC, boolean bPlayedManually, String messageForPlayerWhenForced, StringBuilder stdoutPipeline, StringBuilder stderrPipeline)

      Is called if a player should discard this card (manual or forced by an other player).

      Parameters:
      PC - The Player Controller to play the card for.
      bPlayedManually - True if the player played the card manually, false otherwise.
      messageForPlayerWhenForced - Message to display to the player on his next turn if the card is forced to be played. Null is safe to pass fi played manually.
      stdoutPipeline - Standard output pipeline.
      stderrPipeline - Standard error pipeline.
      Returns:
      Return codes:
      • RC_OK: The card was played successfully. The caller will need to figure out how to update the affected players' hands accordingly.
      • RC_ERR: The card was not played successfully. The caller will need to revert changed variables accordingly.
      • RC_OK_HANDS_UPDATED: The card was played successfully and players hands have been already updated. The caller must not update the hands again.
      • RC_OK_PLAYER_KNOCKED_OUT: The card was played successfully and the player has been knocked out. The caller won't need to do anything else.
      See Also:
      • RC_OK
      • RC_ERR
      • RC_OK_HANDS_UPDATED
      • RC_OK_PLAYER_KNOCKED_OUT

    • callback

      public abstract int callback(PlayerController PC, PlayerController targetPC, StringBuilder stdoutPipeline, StringBuilder stderrPipeline, String[] args)

      Should be called if the card was already played successfully (playCard) and the caller should now choose a player and call the callback method of this card with a valid Player Controller and valid args if needed.

      Parameters:
      PC - The Player Controller to play the card for.
      targetPC - Target Player Controller.
      stdoutPipeline - Standard output pipeline.
      stderrPipeline - Standard error pipeline.
      args - Arguments to pass to the callback method.
      Returns:
      Return codes:
      • RC_OK_HANDS_UPDATED: The card was played successfully and players hands have been already updated. The caller must not update the hands again.
      • RC_ERR: The card was not played successfully. The target Player Controller was invalid or protected. The caller must revert any changes and call this method again.
      See Also:
      • RC_OK_HANDS_UPDATED
      • RC_ERR

    • getName

      Returns:
      Name of the card.
